Overpopulation: With the extended lifespan, the population would increase significantly, leading to overpopulation. This could result in a strain on resources and lead to global crises such as food and water shortages.
Technological Advancements: Humans would have more time to innovate and develop new technologies, leading to advancements in fields such as medicine, energy, and transportation.
Societal Changes: With people living longer, there would be a shift in societal norms and values. For example, retirement would become less common and people would continue to work later in life.
Environmental Impact: With a longer lifespan, people would have a greater impact on the environment, leading to more damage and depletion of resources.

Philosophical Changes: People would have more time to reflect on their lives and their place in the world, leading to changes in their beliefs and values. They would also have more time to pursue their passions and interests.
